ai.summary: Carn Brea BR 32 is a short, easy 0.4 km hike in the UK. The route climbs a small hill with rocky sections and offers views from the summit, along with a sense of local mining history. It's suitable for beginners or a quick outdoor break and can be completed in roughly 10-20 minutes depending on pace and how long you stop to look around.
ai.terrain_summary: The walk follows a short, mostly smooth, compacted path with a few rocky or uneven patches near the summit. Expect loose stones in places and a gentle gradient; steps or ledges may be present in rocky sections. Overall, surface conditions are manageable for most hikers.
ai.safety_notes: As with any UK hill walk, check the forecast and be prepared for sudden weather changes. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and bring a waterproof layer. The summit can be exposed to wind, so dress accordingly. Keep an eye on children and pets, watch for loose rocks on ascent and descent, and avoid the area in icy or severe weather.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a hat/gloves if cold
Map or mobile phone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; year-round with proper gear in winter.

seo.title: Carn Brea BR 32: Quick 0.4 km Easy Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: A concise guide to the 0.4 km easy hike Carn Brea BR 32 in the UK. Terrain, safety tips, gear and best seasons for this short hill walk.
